verses.kjv: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word unto Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Early in the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD to me; Make thee bonds and yokes, and put them upon thy neck,
verses.web: LORD says to me: “Make bonds and bars, and put them on your neck.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Make a set of straps and yoke bars, and put them around your neck.

verses.kjv: And send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the Ammonites, and to the king of Tyrus, and to the king of Zidon, by the hand of the messengers which come to Jerusalem unto Zedekiah king of Judah;
verses.web: Then send them to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of the children of Ammon, to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Sidon, by the hand of the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.ct: Then send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyrus, and the king of Zidon. Give them to the messengers who have come to Jerusalem to meet with Zedekiah king of Judah.

verses.kjv: And command them to say unto their masters, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say unto your masters;
verses.web: Give them a command to their masters, saying, ‘LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “You shall tell your masters:
verses.ct: Tell those messengers to deliver this message to their masters: 'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says — tell your masters:

verses.kjv: I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my outstretched arm, and have given it unto whom it seemed meet unto me.
verses.web: ‘I have made the earth, the men, and the animals that are on the surface of the earth by my great power and by my outstretched arm. I give it to whom it seems right to me.
verses.ct: I made the earth and every person and animal on it by my great power and my outstretched arm. I give it to whoever I choose.

verses.kjv: And now have I given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant; and the beasts of the field have I given him also to serve him.
verses.web: Now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant. I have also given the animals of the field to him to serve him.
verses.ct: Right now, I have handed all these lands over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, my servant. I have even given him the wild animals to be at his command.

verses.kjv: And all nations shall serve him, and his son, and his son’s son, until the very time of his land come: and then many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of him.
verses.web: All the nations will serve him, his son, and his son’s son, until the time of his own land comes. Then many nations and great kings will make him their bondservant.
verses.ct: Every nation will serve him, then his son, and then his grandson, until the time comes for his own land to fall. When that day arrives, many nations and powerful kings will make him their servant.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation will I punish, saith the LORD, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.web: “ ‘ “ ‘It will happen that I will punish the nation and the kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon,’ says LORD, ‘with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.ct: If any nation or kingdom refuses to serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and won't submit to his yoke, I will punish that nation with war, famine, and plague until I have destroyed them through his hand," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore hearken not ye to your prophets, nor to your diviners, nor to your dreamers, nor to your enchanters, nor to your sorcerers, which speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon:
verses.web: But as for you, don’t listen to your prophets, to your diviners, to your dreams, to your soothsayers, or to your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon;”
verses.ct: "So don't listen to your prophets, your fortune-tellers, your dream interpreters, your soothsayers, or your sorcerers when they tell you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.'

verses.kjv: For they prophesy a lie unto you, to remove you far from your land; and that I should drive you out, and ye should perish.
verses.web: for they prophesy a lie to you, to remove you far from your land, so that I would drive you out, and you would perish.
verses.ct: They are feeding you lies, and the result will be that you're torn from your land. I will drive you out, and you will die.

verses.kjv: But the nations that bring their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him, those will I let remain still in their own land, saith the LORD; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.
verses.web: But the nation that brings their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him, that nation I will let remain in their own land,’ says LORD; ‘and they will till it and dwell in it.’ ” ’ ”
verses.ct: But any nation that submits to the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him — I will let that nation stay in its own land," says the LORD. "They will farm it and live there in peace."'

verses.kjv: I spake also to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.
verses.web: I spoke to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.
verses.ct: I gave this same message to Zedekiah king of Judah. I said, "Submit to the yoke of the king of Babylon. Serve him and his people, and you will live.

verses.kjv: Why will ye die, thou and thy people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the LORD hath spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.web: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as LORD has spoken concerning the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.ct: Why would you and your people choose to die by war, famine, and plague? That's exactly what the LORD has promised will happen to any nation that refuses to serve the king of Babylon.

verses.kjv: Therefore hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
verses.web: Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.
verses.ct: Don't listen to the prophets who keep telling you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.' They are lying to you.

verses.kjv: For I have not sent them, saith the LORD, yet they prophesy a lie in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.
verses.web: For I have not sent them,” says LORD, “but they prophesy falsely in my name; that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you, and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
verses.ct: I never sent them," says the LORD. "They are prophesying lies and using my name to do it. The result will be that I drive you out and you perish — both you and the prophets who are deceiving you."

verses.kjv: Also I spake to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus saith the LORD; Hearken not to the words of your prophets that prophesy unto you, saying, Behold, the vessels of the LORD’s house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
verses.web: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, LORD says, “Don’t listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Behold, the vessels of LORD’s house will now shortly be brought again from Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.
verses.ct: I also spoke to the priests and all the people, saying, "This is what the LORD says: Don't listen to your prophets who tell you, 'Look, the sacred vessels from the LORD's house will be brought back from Babylon any day now.' They are lying to you.

verses.kjv: Hearken not unto them; serve the king of Babylon, and live: wherefore should this city be laid waste?
verses.web: Don’t listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city become a desolation?
verses.ct: Don't listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and live. Why should this entire city be turned into a wasteland?

verses.kjv: But if they be prophets, and if the word of the LORD be with them, let them now make intercession to the LORD of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the LORD, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, go not to Babylon.
verses.web: But if they are prophets, and if LORD’s word is with them, let them now make intercession to LORD of Armies, that the vessels which are left in LORD’s house, in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, don’t go to Babylon.
verses.ct: If these men really are prophets and the word of the LORD is with them, then let them pray to the LORD of hosts that the vessels still remaining in the LORD's house, in the palace of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem won't be carried off to Babylon too.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts concerning the pillars, and concerning the sea, and concerning the bases, and concerning the residue of the vessels that remain in this city,
verses.web: For LORD of Armies says concerning the pillars, concerning the sea, concerning the bases, and concerning the rest of the vessels that are left in this city,
verses.ct: Because this is what the LORD of hosts says about the bronze pillars, the great bronze basin called the Sea, the movable stands, and all the other vessels still left in this city —

verses.kjv: Which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took not, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
verses.web: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn’t take when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
verses.ct: the ones that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn't take when he deported Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem —

verses.kjv: Yea, thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the LORD, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem;
verses.web: yes, LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning the vessels that are left in LORD’s house, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem:
verses.ct: yes, this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says about those remaining vessels in the LORD's house, the royal palace, and Jerusalem:

verses.kjv: They shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be until the day that I visit them, saith the LORD; then will I bring them up, and restore them to this place.
verses.web: ‘They will be carried to Babylon, and there they will be, until the day that I visit them,’ says LORD; ‘then I will bring them up, and restore them to this place.’ ”
verses.ct: "They will be carried off to Babylon, and there they will stay until the day I come for them," declares the LORD. "Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place."
